newsitem.title: GERMANY: Commerzbank silent on Creditanstalt talks.
newsitem.headline: Commerzbank silent on Creditanstalt talks.

text.p: Germany's Commerzbank AG on Wednesday declined comment on the state of its negotiations to bid for Austrian privatisation candidate Creditanstalt as part of an Austro-Italian-German consortium.
The Austrian government has issued the consortium an ultimatum to come up with an offer for the bank by Friday, but internal conflict among the consortium members appears to be delaying matters.
"We cannot give a comment. This is a very complicated question and a politically sensitive one in part," said a Commerzbank spokesman.
Earlier Wednesday, Austrian bank Die Erste indicated it might leave the consortium, which also includes Austrian insurer EA Generali and Banca Commerciale Italiana.
Die Erste has proposed setting up a joint holding company with Creditanstalt, a suggestion which Commerzbank is thought to oppose.
The consortium is the only known bidder for the Austrian government's 70 percent stake in Commerzbank, which it has been trying to sell for more than six years.
